page.title: 07Moreton House Farm, Haywood
page.content: The farmer at Moreton House Farm also farms Moreton Barn Farm. He is the only tenant farmer in the area. The present owners did own more farmland locally but these farms have now been sold. He farms a total area of about 340 acres. Moreton House itself is now a private house. The farm buildings were built inside the large walled garden of the original Moreton House. Much of the wall is still visible and one part is built as a double wall. The farmer says the double wall is probably 300 years old, and was heated so that peaches could be grown on its south face. The holes where the fires were lit have been covered but soot can be seen in the wall. Close by the farm may well have been the site of Moreton Manor: although nothing can be seen the farmer has ploughed up sandstone blocks here.
